issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
New ACS app enabled from Studio is not appearing in my.appcelerator.com

Prospect Johnson and Johnson are evaluating our tech based on Open Source Titanium. When they enable cloud services for app (GUID = 7e42b821-600a-4212-98b9-bc5775968dde) and go to my.appcelerator.com, they do not see the app.

The ACS keys are:
prod - z4Tdrzt1YY5wQm1uWMs2aTyvJMheZT8S
dev - tCz7QL0XXr25b3CicaXvNwOH6t5xbfD2
fields.summary: New ACS app enabled from Studio is not appearing in my.appcelerator.com

comments.body:
Just tried my Titanium studio and my.appcelerator.com web console, they all work as expected.

1. Create a default classic project, without enable cloud service.
2. Then enable cloud service after project is created.
3. Check the web console, the app is there and able to manage cloud data.

[~lbrenman], what you mean about ACS app, do you mean a Node.ACS app or a mobile app with cloud service
Thanks Shuo Liang. Client told me it was a Mobile App with cloud service and NOT Node.ACS app. I will double check tomorrow and update the ticket.

Hello, Leor Brenman

I have tested this issue, Titanium studio and my.appcelerator.com web console, they all work as expected.

Hope you will close the issue. Thanks.
